intro: Decaceras huttonii, commonly known as the Hutton's decaceras, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the flowers are usually white or pale green. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
